div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: School Buildings will remain closed for 2019-2020 School Year

a.span: School Buildings will remain closed for 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: Remote Learning will continue until the last day of school on June 23.

a.title: Go to comments for School Buildings will remain closed for 2019-2020 School Year

img.alt: MSBA Votes to Move the Pierce School Building Project Forward

a.span: MSBA Votes to Move the Pierce School Building Project Forward

div.p: At their Board of Directors meeting on April 14, the Massachusetts School Building Authority voted to partner with the Public Schools of Brookline to conduct a Feasibility Study for the Pierce School Building Project.

a.title: Go to comments for MSBA Votes to Move the Pierce School Building Project Forward

div.p: The Brookline School Committee, through its Subcommittee on Policy Review, regularly reviews and, when necessary, revises or creates written policies governing the Public Schools of Brookline. In an effort to improve public feedback on policy revisions, the proposed draft of any policy under review is posted on the Public Schools website when it is approved for a First Reading by the full School Committee.

a.title: Go to comments for School Committee Policies Under Review

img.alt: Urgent Care to Host Drive Through COVID-19 Testing Site in Chestnut Hill for Pre-Screened Patients on April 19

a.span: Urgent Care to Host Drive Through COVID-19 Testing Site in Chestnut Hill for Pre-Screened Patients on April 19

div.p: A drive-through COVID-19 testing site will be set up at PhysicianOne Urgent Care’s Chestnut Hill location, 1210 Boylston Street, on Sunday, April 19, from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Licensed PhysicianOne Urgent Care health care providers will test patients who have completed a medical evaluation prior to Sunday via a Virtual Visit.

a.title: Go to comments for Urgent Care to Host Drive Through COVID-19 Testing Site in Chestnut Hill for Pre-Screened Patients on April 19

div.p: All information and updates regarding COVID-19 (Coronavirus) will be shared here. (Last Update: 4/7/20)

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus (COVID-19): Latest Updates and Information

img.alt: Message from the School Committee and the Brookline Educators Union

a.span: Message from the School Committee and the Brookline Educators Union

div.p: Please read joint statement and the agreement made by the School Committee and the Brookline Educators Union on work that will occur during the school closure to support student learning and connection to their school community.

a.title: Go to comments for Message from the School Committee and the Brookline Educators Union

img.alt: Learning Resources During Extended School Closure

a.span: Learning Resources During Extended School Closure

div.p: The Office of Teaching and Learning is continuing to develop resources to support our families while schools are closed.

a.title: Go to comments for Learning Resources During Extended School Closure
Subscribe to RSS Feed - Central Admin-District News
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - Central Admin-District News

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Brookline Public Schools prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, age, genetic information, marital/parental status, or military/veteran status. This policy provides equal access to courses and programs, counseling services, physical education and athletics, vocational education, instructional materials and extra-curricular activities. Report violations of this policy to the Superintendent's Office, at (617) 730-2401.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: The Public Schools of Brookline is committed to ensuring accessibility of its website for students, parents, and members of the community with disabilities. If you need help accessing content on this website or have any suggestions for improvement, please contact webmaster@psbma.org.
